main event: On April 10, 1962, a circular light was observed in Thayer, Kansas for 2 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as circular, smaller than an aircraft, and emitted a whiter and brighter glow., The object made no sound during the observation., The observation lasted for 2 minutes at 15:40 hours., The report suggests the object had characteristics resembling a body, with white dots potentially being pieces falling from a meteor., The conclusion of the report indicated that the sighting was probably astronomical.
witness description: a local radio announcer who is respected and does not want publicity
